body: Hi All,  I posted last week but got no replies so I'm re-posting this! If you know how to solve this issue, please help me out!  I am trying to use SHDDesigner component to figure out depths for vertical shading devices. Thanks to hydra share, I was able to use the shading designer example file. (linked here:[http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=mostaphaRoudsari&amp...;](http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=mostaphaRoudsari&fork=hydra_1&id=Shading_Designer&slide=0&scale=1&offset=0,0)) I set the horOrVertical input as 'vertical'. But now I get this crazy shading surfaces floating middle of nowhere.. I have attached the gh file and screenshot below.  It works just fine with horizontal shading device option. It would be great if I could get some help on this! Thank you  [](http://api.ning.com/files/yvqovXC4NShWamqzs9tIGiMznU933rfkKF9pznNLm8Qu7UJ6nxbi896i7upUCg7w7hOpvbgrUVYOIjIRRcvZsDyqos7-xC-O/Capture1.PNG)

replies.body: Hi Jais, It happens because the vector is almost perpendicular to the surface. The component gives you a warning about that. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/hFwT9qaJDvNufFAKrd-sjgLdxsIE3TrzsUmcAsdxcjwnwyCtiKlxOY4x8UVrGpGH05OQz0MIthAcTnTNpkOksL628F9sM2QA/warning.jpg) You still can use optional planes input to achieve what you're looking for. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/hFwT9qaJDvP6oIh7oidT4m91UMeUT7o6H9UPcZE7rs99GvBmqVAw7fas17rPQQ5PAqCdv4LXAfhJT*HQxl74a2igA-6DsIza/optionalPlanes.png)
